briefdescription.para: The LinphoneCallStats objects carries various statistic informations regarding quality of audio or video streams.

detaileddescription.para: To receive these informations periodically and as soon as they are computed, the application is invited to place a LinphoneCoreCallStatsUpdatedCb callback in the LinphoneCoreVTable structure it passes for instanciating the LinphoneCore object (see linphone_core_new() ).
At any time, the application can access last computed statistics using linphone_call_get_audio_stats() or linphone_call_get_video_stats().

briefdescription.para: Create a new chat room for messaging from a call if not already existing, else return existing one.

detaileddescription.para:
No reference is given to the caller: the chat room will be deleted when the call is ended.
call
LinphoneCall object
LinphoneChatRoom where messaging can take place.

briefdescription.para: Get the mesured playback volume level (received from remote) in dbm0.
Get the mesured record volume level (sent to remote) in dbm0.
Get speaker volume gain.

detaileddescription.para:
If the sound backend supports it, the returned gain is equal to the gain set with the system mixer.
call
The call.
Percenatge of the max supported volume gain. Valid values are in [ 0.0 : 1.0 ]. In case of failure, a negative value is returned

briefdescription.para: Set speaker volume gain.

detaileddescription.para:
If the sound backend supports it, the new gain will synchronized with the system mixer.
call
The call.
volume
Percentage of the max supported gain. Valid values are in [ 0.0 : 1.0 ].

briefdescription.para: Get microphone volume gain.

detaileddescription.para:
If the sound backend supports it, the returned gain is equal to the gain set with the system mixer.
call
The call.
double Percenatge of the max supported volume gain. Valid values are in [ 0.0 : 1.0 ]. In case of failure, a negative value is returned

briefdescription.para: Set microphone volume gain.

detaileddescription.para:
If the sound backend supports it, the new gain will synchronized with the system mixer.
call
The call.
volume
Percentage of the max supported gain. Valid values are in [ 0.0 : 1.0 ].

briefdescription.para: Obtain real-time quality rating of the call.

detaileddescription.para: Based on local RTP statistics and RTCP feedback, a quality rating is computed and updated during all the duration of the call. This function returns its value at the time of the function call. It is expected that the rating is updated at least every 5 seconds or so. The rating is a floating point number comprised between 0 and 5.
4-5 = good quality 3-4 = average quality 2-3 = poor quality 1-2 = very poor quality 0-1 = can't be worse, mostly unusable

simplesect.para: The function returns -1 if no quality measurement is available, for example if no active audio stream exist. Otherwise it returns the quality rating.

briefdescription.para: Returns call quality averaged over all the duration of the call.

detaileddescription.para: See linphone_call_get_current_quality() for more details about quality measurement.

briefdescription.para: Start call recording.

detaileddescription.para: The output file where audio is recorded must be previously specified with linphone_call_params_set_record_file().

briefdescription.para: Stop call recording.
Get a player associated with the call to play a local file and stream it to the remote peer.
Indicates whether an operation is in progress at the media side.

detaileddescription.para:
It can be a bad idea to initiate signaling operations (adding video, pausing the call, removing video, changing video parameters) while the media is busy in establishing the connection (typically ICE connectivity checks). It can result in failures generating loss of time in future operations in the call. Applications are invited to check this function after each call state change to decide whether certain operations are permitted or not.
call
the call
TRUE if media is busy in establishing the connection, FALSE otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Call generic OpenGL render for a given call.
Send a LinphoneInfoMessage through an established call.
Return a copy of the call statistics for a particular stream type.
Add a listener in order to be notified of LinphoneCall events.

detaileddescription.para:
Once an event is received, registred LinphoneCallCbs are invoked sequencially.
call
LinphoneCall object to monitor.
cbs
A LinphoneCallCbs object holding the callbacks you need. A reference is taken by the LinphoneCall until you invoke linphone_call_remove_callbacks().

briefdescription.para: Remove a listener from a LinphoneCall.
Gets the current LinphoneCallCbs.

detaileddescription.para:
This is meant only to be called from a callback to be able to get the user_data associated with the LinphoneCallCbs that is calling the callback.
call
LinphoneCall object
The LinphoneCallCbs that has called the last callback

briefdescription.para: Set call parameters - advanced and not recommended feature - use with caution.

detaileddescription.para:
Local call parameters applicable to an outgoing or incoming shall usually be passed to linphone_core_invite_address_with_params() or linphone_call_accept_with_params(). However, in some cases it might be desirable from a software design standpoint to modify local parameters outside of the application layer, typically in the purpose of implementing a custom logic including special headers in INVITE or 200Ok requests, driven by a call_state_changed listener method. This function accepts to assign a new LinphoneCallParams only in LinphoneCallOutgoingInit and LinphoneCallIncomingReceived states.
call
the LinphoneCall object

briefdescription.para: Returns local parameters associated with the call.

detaileddescription.para:
This is typically the parameters passed at call initiation to linphone_core_invite_address_with_params() or linphone_call_accept_with_params(), or some default parameters if no LinphoneCallParams was explicitely passed during call initiation.
call
the LinphoneCall object
the call's local parameters.

simplesect.para: The type of the stream the stats refer to

Get the local loss rate since last report.

briefdescription.para: Gets the remote reported interarrival jitter.

simplesect.para: The interarrival jitter at last received receiver report

briefdescription.para: Gets the cumulative number of late packets.

simplesect.para: The cumulative number of late packets

briefdescription.para: Get the bandwidth measurement of the received stream, expressed in kbit/s, including IP/UDP/RTP headers.

simplesect.para: The bandwidth measurement of the received stream in kbit/s.

briefdescription.para: Get the bandwidth measurement of the sent stream, expressed in kbit/s, including IP/UDP/RTP headers.

simplesect.para: The bandwidth measurement of the sent stream in kbit/s.

briefdescription.para: Get the state of ICE processing.
Get the state of uPnP processing.

simplesect.para: The IP address family of the remote peer.

briefdescription.para: Get the jitter buffer size in ms.

simplesect.para: The jitter buffer size in ms.

briefdescription.para: Get the round trip delay in s.

simplesect.para: The round trip delay in s.

briefdescription.para: received_rtcp field of LinphoneCallStats object has been updated
sent_rtcp field of LinphoneCallStats object has been updated
Every seconds LinphoneCallStats object has been updated.

memberdef.name: LINPHONE_VOLUME_DB_LOWEST
memberdef.initializer: (-120) /* WARNING: keep this in sync with mediastreamer2/msvolume.h */

briefdescription.para: Lowest volume measurement that can be returned by linphone_call_get_play_volume() or linphone_call_get_record_volume(), corresponding to pure silence.
Obtaining information about a running call: sound volumes, quality indicators.

detaileddescription.para: When a call is running, it is possible to retrieve in real time current measured volumes and quality indicator.
